name: Baek Kimchi (Korean White Non-Spicy Kimchi)
author: mykoreaneats
summary: We thought venturing into other kimchi domains would be a wise decision, especially with the warmer weather. This type of kimchi is perfect for those who can't handle spicy foods and is milder in flavor. Enjoy with rice and other meals.
ingredients: 2  jujube (Chinese dates), or more to taste  (Optional)
½  Korean radish, cut into matchsticks
1  red chile pepper, seeded and thinly sliced, or more to taste
1  green chile pepper, seeded and thinly sliced, or more to taste
directions: Dissolve 1/2 cup coarse salt in a large bowl of water
Submerge cabbage in the salted water and let soak, 12 to 24 hours
Rinse well and drain, squeezing out excess water
Soak jujube in a small bowl of water for 10 to 15 minutes
Drain, pit, and cut into thin slices
Combine 1/2 cup water, salted shrimp, scallions, garlic, and ginger in a food processor; puree until smooth
Pour puree into a large bowl; add jujube, radish, chestnuts, pear, carrots, red chile pepper, green chile pepper, brown sugar, and 2 teaspoon salt
Mix in cabbage until well coated
Pack cabbage mixture into an airtight jar
Pour in any liquid left in the bowl
Seal and let sit at room temperature until starting to ferment, 1 to 2 days
